content.description: The crux comes half way through the problem when you are confronted with a length reach to a sharp jug. Fancy footwork and a pinch out to the right will get you to the lip where you can mantle and gain the top out.
content.protection: 3-4 pads and one or two spotters.
content.location: The start is with your left hand in a seam on the left side of the boulder and your right hand on a crimp. From there you traverse the length of the boulder to the right which is where you top out.

content.description: Start with your hands matched on the starting jug and your feet up against the boulder in the cave feature. From there reach right to a decent hold. Then move your right had to a crimp. Match with the left and throw for jug out left. Not a super long problem but it has pretty fun movement.
content.location: This is the first problem visible when you reach the boulder via the approach trail. It starts on the obvious rail/ jug on the right side of the cave feature.
